author: Tim Gideon
title: Yamaha YH-E700B - Review 2024 - PCMag UK
text:
Pros Adjustable EQ Quality accessories Cons Underwhelming lows and mids Noise cancellation isn't on par with the competition Yamaha YH-E700B Specs Active Noise Cancellation
Connection Type Bluetooth Connection Type Stereo 3.5mm Connection Type USB-C Type Circumaural (over-ear) Wireless
All Specs
Yamaha's YH-E700B noise-cancelling headphones are easy to overlook. At $349.95, they're priced to compete with the Bose QuietComfort Headphones ($349), the Bose QuietComfort Ultra Headphones ($429), and the Sony WH-1000XM5 ($399.99), all of which offer superior active noise cancellation (ANC) and more accurate audio. By comparison, the YH-E700B's default sound signature is lacking in both the lows and mids and they aren’t as effective at eliminating noise. They ship with decent accessories and their companion app's adjustable EQ can bring out the drivers’ full potential, but that's not enough to make them competitive. It's worth noting, however, that they are sometimes on sale for less than half of their list price, which helps make them an intriguing alternative to the above-mentioned models if you're shopping on a budget.
A Snug Fit With Premium Accessories Available in beige or black, the YH-E700B headphones have a circumaural (over-ear) design. Their earpads and headband feature generous cushioning and a leather-like lining. I found the fit comfortable and secure even over extended listening sessions, but you might not like how snugly the earpads hug your ear. Given their relatively small interior cutouts, they might end up feeling more like they are sitting on top of your ears rather than surrounding them.
Internally, 40mm dynamic drivers deliver a frequency range of 8Hz to 20kHz. The headphones are compatible with Bluetooth 5.2 and support the AAC, AptX Adaptive, and SBC codecs . The Bose QuietComfort Ultra Headphones match this codec support, while the Sony WH-1000XM5 offers LDAC in place of AptX Adaptive, an advantage for Android users who care about getting the highest possible streaming bit rates. Yamaha's headphones support Google Fast Pair but not multi-point connectivity.
(Credit: Tim Gideon) The tactile, on-ear controls are easy enough to operate. The largest button on the right earcup’s side panel handles power, playback, and calls, while the smaller two adjacent buttons control volume (short presses) and track navigation (long presses). I prefer independent track and volume controls since they reduce the chance of accidental presses; Yamaha could have easily separated them given the ample space. The left earcup houses a button that cycles through Ambient Sound (transparency), ANC on, and ANC off modes. Oddly, if you accidentally run your finger over the exterior ANC mics near the controls on either side, the headphones emit a mildly unpleasant noise.
(Credit: Tim Gideon) The headphones collapse and swivel at the earcups to fit inside the included hard-shell, zip-up carrying case. An internal pocket holds the included accessories: a USB-A-to-USB-C charging cable that connects to the USB-C port on the right earcup, a 3.5mm headphone cable that connects to the jack at the base of the left earcup for passive listening, and a dual-jack flight adapter.
Yamaha estimates that the headphones can last up to 32 hours, but does not specify whether this figure is with ANC active. As such, expect your real-world results to differ somewhat. The company claims it takes 3.5 hours to fully charge from empty.
Yamaha YH-E700B App Experience The Yamaha Headphone Control app (available for Android and iOS) is overly simple, but it works well enough and provides some value.
At the top of the main page, the app shows a battery life readout for the headphones. Below this, an Equalizer tile leads you to some vaguely labeled presets, such as Energy and Gentle, along with two adjustable presets with five bands each. The app doesn't tell you which frequencies the bands correspond to, but the EQ does noticeably affect the sound signature.
(Credit: Yamaha) Below the EQ tile, there’s an Ambient Sound Control section that allows you to switch between Noise Cancelling, Ambient Sound, and Off modes. None of these selections brings up additional functions, however. Your only options are to toggle various audio controls: Listening Care (which improves sound at lower volumes), Listening Optimizer (which optimizes sound performance), and Gaming Mode (which reduces latency). I recommend leaving the first two off since it's not clear what they accomplish, but there's no harm in trying them.
Rounding out the app is a basic Settings menu that lets you download firmware updates, adjust the auto-off behavior, and toggle audio prompts and on-ear detection. You can also disable Google Analytics if you don't want the app to collect performance data.

author: mdzol.com
title: Patricia Bullrich incluyó a cuatro municipios mendocinos en un plan de emergencia para reducir los homicidios
text:
Patricia Bullrich incluyó a cuatro municipios mendocinos en un plan de emergencia para reducir los homicidios
El Ministerio de Seguridad iniciará el "Plan 90/10" con el objetivo de reducir los homicidios y violencia relacionada en 14 comunas del país, distribuidas en cuatro provincias.
El Ministerio de Seguridad de la Nación, que conduce Patricia Bullrich, aprobó este miércoles una resolución con la cual comenzará a aplicar el llamado "Plan 90/10", que tiene como objetivo reducir los homicidios en departamentos "más críticos" a nivel país.
Mendoza no es ajena a esto. De hecho, está dentro del lote de las cuatro provincias donde se aplicará este "Plan Territorial de reducción de Homicidios y Violencia Relacionada", junto a Santa Fe, Buenos Aires y Córdoba.
Municipios "calientes"
En total, son 14 departamentos "calientes" donde se llevarán a cabo las maniobras de seguridad. De la provincia, están nombradas la , , y Guaymallén.
Además, aparecen de Santa Fe, la ciudad de Rosario (Rosario y Villa Gobernador Gálvez), más Santa Fe Capital; de Tucumán, San Miguel de Tucumán; de Córdoba, la Capital y Gran Córdoba; y de Buenos Aires, están incluidas Esteban Echeverría, General Pueyrredón, General San Martín y Tres de Febrero.
Según informó la Nación, el Plan 90/10 tiene ese nombre ya que focalizará la intervención del Estado "en el 10% de los municipios del país" mediante estrategias de "prevención, control del delito y fortalecimiento institucional". Estos territorios "concentran el 70% de la población nacional y el 90% de los homicidios intencionales".
No obstante, en los anexos de la resolución se determinó que las 14 jurisdicciones "priorizadas" para las medidas de prevención del delito "tienen sólo el 15% de la población total del país, y en ellas se cometen 1 de cada 3 homicidios intencionales".
En la resolución 448/25, se estableció que el Ministerio de Seguridad Nacional "coordinará las acciones de los Cuerpos Policiales y las Fuerzas Policiales y de Seguridad Federales, las que podrá delegar en el funcionario que designe a tal efecto".
También se "invitó" a las jurisdicciones provinciales "a adherir a los alcances establecidos por la presente Resolución", que no implicará ningún tipo de erogaciones presupuestarias.
Narcomenudeo y lavado de dinero
Desde el Gobierno, la ministra de Seguridad, Mercedes Rus, ha valorado el plan nacional, y solicitó que se aplique para los casos de investigaciones y operativos en conjunto con la Justicia Federal relativo a los delitos de narcomenudeo (estupefacientes) y también lavado de activos.
"Para nosotros es muy importante reforzar las investigaciones profundas en eso", marcó.
En este sentido, agregó vendrá a Mendoza "una dotación de Policía Federal para que atienda las investigaciones profusas que nosotros queremos tener en materia de estos delitos federales".
"Desde octubre del año pasado, venimos trabajando muy bien todas las fuerzas en los operativos. El primer operativo conjunto fue el del barrio Santa Teresita. El 90/10 lo vamos a aplicar con esta lógica y con esta perspectiva, que es la que hemos pedido, que es la que entendemos que es importante para la estrategia de seguridad de la provincia".
Datos de homicidios
Para la cartera de Bullrich, si bien en términos generales la tasa de homicidios "se mantiene en niveles moderados" comparados con países de la región, "persisten focos críticos en ciertas áreas urbanas y territorios con alta marginalidad social".
En términos de homicidios, la Ciudad de Mendoza tuvo en 2023 una tasa de 5,8 homicidios cada 100.000 habitantes. Luego aparece Godoy Cruz, con una tasa de 5,3 homicidios; Las Heras, con 5,3; y Guaymallén, con 3,2 cada 100.000 habitantes.
De igual forma, estos valores son sensiblemente menores a las ciudades santafesinas; y también se ha registrado una baja progresiva -salvo algunos repuntes- con el paso de los años.
Quizás el ejemplo más claro es el de la Ciudad de Mendoza, que pasó de una tasa de 20,2 homicidios cada 100.000 habitantes en 2014, a 5,8.
En tanto, no está de más poner la lupa en Godoy Cruz, que si bien también hace una década tenía una tasa de 14,5 homicidios, supo tener en 2022 una tasa del 1,9, pero ese número rebotó al 5,3.
Por otro lado, en lo que corresponde a la tasa de homicidios dolosos, también en 2023, aparecen los siguientes datos respecto a Mendoza. En la Ciudad de Mendoza hubo 7 víctimas, lo que dio una tasa de 5,8; en Godoy Cruz hubo 10 víctimas y una tasa de 4,8; en Guaymallén, 11 víctimas en todo el 2023, con una tasa del 3,2; y finalmente Las Heras, con 13 homicidios y una tasa del 5,3.
"La priorización de territorios a intervenir se realizó a partir de un diagnóstico centrado en una serie de indicadores de actividad criminal, sociodemográficos y otros de relevancia estratégica. En ciertos casos, el listado de municipios priorizados fue completado con otros municipios colindantes por integrar conglomerados urbanos que no pueden ser disociados desde el punto de vista de la estrategia de prevención", destacó la Nación.
El plan de trabajo de seguridad en las comunas
Desde el ministerio que conduce Bullrich se plantea "la desarticulacion redes delictivas y estructuras criminales que promueven la violencia letal; el fortalecimiento de las capacidades de las Fuerzas Policiales y de Seguridad Federales, y del sistema de justicia, para aumentar el esclarecimiento y la sanción de los homicidios; así como también la disminución de la circulación y el uso ilegal de armas de fuego".
Otro de los objetivos es "recuperar el control territorial en zonas de alta conflictividad donde el Estado ha perdido presencia frente a actores violentos".
El Ministerio aseguró que la "experiencia internacional y la evidencia basada en estudios de criminología" sugieren que las políticas públicas en la reducción de homicidios contienen algunos planes que se aplicarán a partir de la implementación de este programa, con las siguientes actuaciones:
- Intervenciones focalizadas en territorios críticos.
- Coordinación entre niveles de gobierno y Fuerzas Policiales y de Seguridad Federales. - Un análisis profundo de los factores de riesgo, tanto individuales como estructurales.
- Focalización en el crimen organizado y la violencia armada.
- Control del acceso a armas de fuego.
- Incluir una combinación de estrategias preventivas y punitivas que involucren tanto a las Fuerzas Policiales y de Seguridad Federales como a la comunidad.
"Este Plan se erige como una respuesta integral, basada en evidencia para reducir no solo las tasas de homicidios intencionales, sino también los factores asociados a la violencia en los territorios más afectados, sin dejar de atender demandas específicas de inclusión realizadas por los gobernadores provinciales a partir de evidencia empírica que surgen de fuentes de datos provinciales", acotaron.

organizations.name: Ministerio de Seguridad de la Nación

author: ET Online
title: imtiaz ali: Imtiaz Ali reveals how Bhagavad Gita and Rig Veda reshaped his worldview at young age: 'It’s deeply ingrained in me' - The Economic Times
text:
Agencies Director Imtiaz Ali Renowned director Imtiaz Ali recently opened up about how reading the Rig Veda and Bhagavad Gita at a young age deeply influenced his understanding of life and people . In an interview with Ranveer Allahbadia, Ali discussed how these sacred texts became a significant part of his early reading experiences. Ali recalled being profoundly moved by the hymn of creation from the Rig Veda, which he encountered in a book.
#Elections with ET Lok Sabha Exit Poll Results 2024: Track all updates here
Imtiaz Ali On Discovering Bhagavad Gita
He shared, “I couldn’t move past it; I understood what it meant. Bhagavad Gita has also been an important book in my life. It's still the book I keep on my table. In sixth grade, I was traveling alone by train, and money was tight. Ironically, it was the only book I could afford to buy at the railway station. I thought people around me would find it strange that I was reading it,” he explained.
Ali was pleasantly surprised by the Bhagavad Gita’s accessibility. “There were a few things I had to re-read multiple times to understand, but I eventually grasped them. I would read a few pages every day. It’s now deeply ingrained in me; I’m fortunate to have been exposed to it at such a young age. It has helped me understand people better. I’ve read other religious texts too, and they’re interesting and entertaining. If I find a nugget that resonates with me, it makes my day,” he added.
The director also discussed the box office failure of the 2017 romance comedy ' Jab Harry Met Sejal ', starring Shah Rukh Khan and Anushka Sharma. Ali admitted that he tried to “experiment” with the film, but it didn’t perform well.
Despite the movie's failure, he expressed a sense of ownership over it, saying, “So what if it didn’t do well, it is still your film,’ I was told. I felt a sense of ownership over the film. I wanted to tell it, ‘I am not embarrassed of you, you are mine, as much as any other film of mine.’ I felt a strange melancholy, a deep pain, that this was an unsuccessful film. Back then, I was reading people’s faces and sensing disappointment. I had dengue and was bedridden for a month,” Ali recalled.
Imtiaz Ali's Recent Work Imtiaz Ali’s latest directorial venture, ‘Amar Singh Chamkila’, featuring Diljit Dosanjh and Parineeti Chopra, is a biographical drama available on Netflix . It tells the story of the iconic Punjabi singer Amar Singh Chamkila and his wife Amarjot Kaur, and has received positive reviews from audiences and critics alike.
Reflecting on his childhood, Ali shared how reading religious texts like the Bhagavad Gita and Rig Veda profoundly shaped his life. He emphasized the simplicity and depth of the Bhagavad Gita, stating, “It was so easy to understand. There was hardly anything in it that I did not understand, but there were a lot of things that I read 5-10 times.” He added that the Bhagavad Gita has always been a crucial part of his life, often kept on his side table.
Ali mentioned that he also enjoys reading other religious texts, finding them both entertaining and insightful. “They offer quite interesting things,” he said, noting that he used to read the Rig Veda daily for a long period.

author: Jarvis the NPC
title: FIFA Gameplay Troubles: Why Players Are Quitting Left and Right
text:
FIFA has become a battlefield, but not in the way the developers envisioned. Players are waving their white flags as they battle something far more insidious than rival teams—it’s the desolated servers and frustrating input delays that have collectively sent FIFA players into a spiral of despair. In a recent post on a popular forum, one player humorously encapsulated the chaotic state of the game, stating, “The game is cooked,” which has become an apt description of the current FIFA experience. Join me as I sift through the aromatic chaos of complaints and chuckles that stem from this digital bacchanal.
Summary
- Persistent input delays and connectivity issues have left many players frustrated and ready to quit.
- Players are reporting a drastic drop in gameplay quality, coinciding with the TOTS event.
- The consensus seems to be that playing during off-peak hours might yield better results.
- Some players are just mentally checked out despite the technical problems.
The Input Delay Dilemma
As any veteran FIFA player knows, the game revolves around precise timing and split-second decisions. Imagine gearing up for that intense showdown only to find your player moving a heartbeat later than they should. One frustrated poster shared their experience, claiming they must quit 95% of their matches because, “I can’t tackle, I can’t pass—defenders [are] standing around like they are on strike!” The overflowing annoyance is infectious. Sarcasm drips from the comments like sweat from a worried gamer’s brow. For many, the input delays render the core mechanics of the game virtually worthless, making it feel more like a wobbly circus act than a fluid football simulation.
“Gameplay gets worse with every patch,” railed another user, underscoring the frustration with a system that seems to spiral downward with each new update. Players are deeply divided between wanting to enjoy the game and feeling betrayed by its instability, akin to dating someone who only calls you when they are bored.
The TOTS Curse
The TOTS (Team of the Season) event was once a highly anticipated occasion, but it seems this year it has turned into a necessary evil. A comment from a player hilariously described the changes, stating, “Feels like I am playing a totally different game now,” presumably lamenting the loss of their former tactical excellence. The blame seems to rest heavily on this seasonal event, with players saying everything has turned inexplicably weird: “Weird touches, inconsistent passes, input delays—a perfect storm of frustration!”
The TOTS event that was once a source of excitement has now become synonymous with quicksand gameplay and bizarre mechanics. One user lamented how fun content creation feels stale now, saying, “Even the content is boring now,” while others echoed a sentiment that the game’s fun factor has simply flatlined during this event. So what happened to that euphoric prelude to TOTS? Did FIFA serve up a plate of chaos with a side of inconsistency? If only players knew the menu featured ‘frustration à la carte’ beforehand.
Peak Time Shenanigans
It seems every FIFA player has realized one universal truth: if you don’t want to feel like you’re playing on dial-up, avoid peak hours like the plague. One user humorously uncovered the not-so-secret strategy in an emphatic comment: “I can only get good gameplay when the children are in school or bed.” So, it appears that if you want to score some sweet goals and not suffer the indignation of lag, plan those sessions during the early morning or late night. It’s a bit like trying to sneak your way into a party when the crowd is out and about.
The infamous notion of the “hamster-driven server switch” is alive and well, and knowing that it can essentially ruin your game raises eyebrows. It’s baffling that the servers seem to morph into their unplayable forms around 4 PM UK time, morphing the gameplay into something akin to a jittery game of charades. When the servers become less reliable than your Wi-Fi connection during a thunderstorm, it’s small wonder that players feel an urge to rage quit.
The Future of FIFA: Hope or Hopelessness?
So, what does the future hold for FIFA amidst these turbulent waves of dissatisfaction? Given the sheer volume of players expressing their discontent, one has to wonder whether EA Sports is listening or simply tuning out like a DJ at a party where no one is dancing. Players are left contemplating if it’s time for an extended break, or if there might be some glimmer of hope for improvement in the pipeline.
Yet, amidst this sea of frustration, there are rays of hope glimmering faintly at the horizon. One player noted they are “still trying” and taking the hiccups in stride despite the challenges. Their resolve signals that there are still players who are willing to endure through the rain to reach the proverbial rainbow. Another noted that they can find joy in other games, yet they always circle back to FIFA, showcasing the magnetic pull the series has over its audience.
When the dust finally settles here, it doesn’t seem that players will quit for good. They will demand better service; they will voice their concerns at megaphone volume. It’s part of the spirited passion that’s inherent in devoted FIFA fans. Whether or not these issues get addressed, one thing remains certain: there is always another match to play, and even if it’s wobbly and weird, their fingers will be ready on those controllers—input delays or not!

title: Ground News - Letter: Let’s reinvest in our rail system
text:
Summary by vaildaily.com What a great article about trains in the Wednesday Vail Daily. Colorado could become a model for the country. title: Ground News - Injured Bavuma ruled out of Cape Town Test
text:
Summary by Ground News Zubayr Hamza will join the squad, while Dean Elgar will serve as captain. Bavuma suffered a strain to his left hamstring in the first session of the Boxing Day Test against India. He will have the injury assessed in two weeks' time to determine his availability. author: @infoitcultura
title: Pete Doherty rischia l'amputazione delle dita dei piedi: la battaglia contro il diabete
text:
Pete Doherty rischia l’amputazione delle dita dei piedi: la battaglia contro il diabete
Articolo Precedente
Articolo Successivo
La diagnosi di diabete di tipo 2
Pete Doherty, celebre frontman dei Libertines, sta affrontando una difficile battaglia contro il diabete di tipo 2. Secondo quanto riportato da diverse fonti, il cantante rischia l’amputazione delle dita dei piedi a causa delle complicazioni legate alla sua condizione. Doherty ha recentemente dichiarato di aver scoperto la sua malattia in seguito a sintomi che non poteva più ignorare. (Radio Kiss Kiss)
